section: Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This clause states that the due dates are guaranteed by the Company regardless of whether the company receives required materials from the client. This is an inconsistency as the Company cannot guarantee due dates if the Client fails to provide what is required in a timely fashion, creating uncertainty.

section: However, the Client can pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.
explanation: This clause introduces an ambiguity regarding the payment deadline. The original text states that the Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. Then another sentence states that, the client can make the remaining payments at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: These two clauses present an internal contradiction. The first sentence in this section clearly states that Company cannot stop Customer Service throughout the duration of the agreement, but the following sentence contradicts that stating the Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
